isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AXLE SHIFT UNIT: EATON - AIR SHIFT SYSTEM - SHIFT UNIT

step1.para: Disconnect air line at shift unit cover. Remove nuts, flat washers and piston air shift unit from differential carrier.

note.para: When shift unit is removed, provide container to catch the oil that escapes from the reservoir.

step1.para: Remove shift fork seal and spring.
Remove capscrews, lockwashers, cover and gasket from housing. Drain lubricant.
Remove bolts, locknuts, and cover at piston end of housing. Remove O-ring.

warning.para: During the following procedure, the piston will pop out of the housing under spring pressure. Exercise caution to prevent possible injury.

step1.para: Remove compression spring and piston stop from bore of shift unit housing ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Compression Spring and Piston Stop

step1.para: Remove clevis pin, then remove push rod from shift unit housing. Remove O-ring from push rod.
Remove actuating lever and pin assembly from shift unit housing ( Figure 27). Do not disassemble actuating lever.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Actuating Lever and Pin Assembly

svcsubproc.title: Lubrication
svcsubproc.para: Lubricant: Use SAE 10 motor oil* for temperatures above 0°F (-18°C). For temperatures below 0°F (-18°C), mix three parts of SAE 10 motor oil with one part of kerosene. This cold weather mixture can be safely used up to 32°F (0°C).

note.para: Commercially available automatic transmission fluid may be used in place of SAE 10 motor oil. Automatic transmission fluid can be used for all temperatures. Do not mix kerosene with automatic transmission fluid.

svcsubproc.para: Lubricant Check and Level: Each 20,000 miles or six months, remove pipe plug in shift unit housing cover to check lubricant level. Lube should be level with bottom of filler hole.

Lubricant Change: At least once a year, remove shift unit housing cover and drain old lubricant. Wash parts thoroughly and air dry. Reinstall cover. Remove pipe plug in cover. Fill through pipe plug opening until lube is level with bottom of filler hole.

svcsubproc.title: Inspect
svcsubproc.para: Shift Fork Seal: Inspect shift fork seal for defects and tight fit on shift fork. A spring is used to assure a closer fit of seal around shift fork. If this spring is not present on axle being serviced, install one when reassembling unit.
O-Rings, Felt Oilers and Gasket: Replace O-rings, felt oilers and cover gasket when piston air shift unit is disassembled for repair.
Compression Spring: Inspect spring for distortion, cracks, or other visual defects. Replace a faulty spring.

Actuating Lever and Pins: Inspect lever pins and bearings for worn or grooved condition. Inspect actuating lever and push rod for worn or elongated holes at point where they are connected. Replace faulty parts.
Piston: Inspect piston friction surface for worn, grooved or damaged condition which will affect the piston movement in cylinder. Replace a faulty piston.

note.para: Prior to reassembly, the piston felt oilers should be soaked in SAE 10 oil for one hour. Lubricate O-rings with a high viscosity silicone oil or barium grease O-ring lubricant.

step1.para: Assemble pin to actuating lever and install this assembly in shift unit housing ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Piston and Push Rod Reassembly

step1.para: Assemble O-ring and piston to push rod and fasten with flat washer and locknut. Tighten locknut to 120 to 150 in-lbs. (14 to 17 N•m). Install felt oilers and O-ring on piston.

warning.para: During the following procedure using a press, make certain components are properly aligned in press to prevent possible personal injury or damage to parts.

step1.para: Insert piston stop and compression spring in shift unit housing. Place piston and push rod assembly in housing. Position housing assembly in arbor press.
Apply pressure to piston until actuating lever is in alignment with push rod end ( Figure 29). Install clevis pin. Release press.

Place cover gasket in position on shift unit housing, then install cover and bearing assembly. Fasten with capscrews and lockwashers. If necessary, use a sealer on the threads of capscrews to prevent any leaking. Tighten capscrews to 90 to 110 in-lbs. (10 to 12 N•m).
Place O-ring in groove of shift unit housing, then install housing cover (piston end) and secure with bolts and locknuts. Tighten locknuts to 108 to 132 in-lbs. (12 to 15 N•m).
Fill shift unit with SAE 10 oil or automatic transmission fluid. Refer to LUBRICATION, when axle is installed in vehicle.
Lubricate shift fork. Slide seal and spring assembly over fork and place on differential carrier studs.
Place shift unit on mounting studs and make certain shift fork actuating lever engages slot in shift fork. Install flat washers and stud nuts. Tighten nuts to 55 to 61 ft-lbs. (74 to 82 N•m).
When axle is installed in vehicle, fill shift unit housing to level of filler plug with SAE 10 oil. Coat threads of filler plug with sealer and install plug.
Connect air lines to shift unit cover.
